intro: Octomeria ruthiana, commonly known as the silverleaf octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage, which helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Octomeria ruthiana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
